bibl.title: ""The Vertigo of Love"" (P.Sapph.Obbink 21-29; P.Oxy. 1231, fr. 16). Translated from the French by Paul Ellis and Chiara Meccariello.
The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2

bibl.note: P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738); P.Oxy. X, 1231 (= M.-P.3 1445; LDAB 3893), fr. 16. - ""Now, here, the one you love"": A new poem. - Sappho summed up in a single poem. - A fictional and poetic female ""I"". - A female object of love: is Eros ""Gendered""? - Dizziness and vertigo of love.
bibl.seg: Sandra Boehringer & Claude Calame, ""The Vertigo of Love"" (P.Sapph.Obbink 21-29; P.Oxy. 1231, fr. 16). Translated from the French by Paul Ellis and Chiara Meccariello.

Anton Bierl & André Lardinois (edd.), The Newest Sappho: P. Sapph. Obbink and P. GC inv. 105, Frs. 1-4 = Studies in Archaic and Classical Greek Song. 2 = Mnemosyne. Supplements. 392 (Leiden - Boston, 2016) pp. 353-367.

P. Coll. privées: P. Green Inv. 105 (= M.-P.3 1445.01; LDAB 341738) + P. Coll. privées [P. Sapph. Obbink] (= M.-P.3 1445.02; LDAB 341738); P.Oxy. X, 1231 (= M.-P.3 1445; LDAB 3893), fr. 16. - ""Now, here, the one you love"": A new poem. - Sappho summed up in a single poem. - A fictional and poetic female ""I"". - A female object of love: is Eros ""Gendered""? - Dizziness and vertigo of love.
